line.comment: * Zero Hour 1.8b: player being held accountable for kills scored by hired Mercs
* Add-Ons 1.4.20: Moved to script.
* Mordan9
* Force no loot drops from Player outposts, so that when upgrading to Capital shipyard, nothing drops.
* Yes, this means if you transfer an outpost to the A.I. and then kill it, it still won't drop anything. Deal with it.
* Mordan9 - If requested to drop all loot, and the player is in-sector, stations will drop some of whatever they contain. This is built in.
* However, if the player is OOS, the game does not naturally drop loot from stations, so we do it here.
* Drop loot
* We have to manually drop stuff if the player is not in this sector because it's not built into the game. What percentage to drop is anyones best guess.
* From 1/2 to 1/4 of each item drops.
* Note, when In-Sector with the player, the game will handle station loot drops. I think it drops everything, but not sure.
* Don't drop loot
* Normally, this simply removes wares from the station cargo so they do not drop. A couple exceptions were added.
* Mordan4 - Renegade station drops all it's loot. Otherwise, remove stuff from the station.
* Mordan4 - Pirate bases now drop a portion of their cargo bay. Note, this does not try to drop marines.
* destroy n units of the ware
* Undock all ships.

line.text: ' была уничтожена. Ваши корабли были отстыкованы.'

line.comment: * Mordan4 - Gift renegade system to player if the renegade station dies. Also set special ship discount for player by setting the plot completed.
* write to log file 1 append=[TRUE] printf: fmt='Station %s destroyed. IsRenegade = %s', [THIS], $IsRenegadeStation, null, null, null
* Congratulations etc.. ship building costs have been reduced bla bla
* Add-Ons 1.2: mission complete! congratulations! (1.4.11: Removed delay - was allowing station to be visible for 2 seconds after death.)
* Truce broken (Player only).
* Add-Ons 1.4: Play ping sound and display total infamy.
* Add-Ons 1.4.20: Consistency with !ship.signal.killed

line.text: 'Во время кризиса вы уничтожили станцию фракции '

line.comment: * Mordan3 - Player outpost destroyed, having the Jump Station perk. Update global showing how many they have available.
* Add-Ons 1.1: If the sector had any ongoing terraforming projects, abort them due to outpost destruction.
* Add-Ons 1.5: Destroy associated jump station objects.
* currently ongoing planet projects
* * DEBUG **
* $t = 'outpost destroyed. statuses: ' + $terraformingStatuses
* write to player logbook $t
* No player outpost due to destruction.
* Company penalty (Player only).

line.text: 'Вы уничтожили станцию компании и лишились репутации у всех фракций.'

line.comment: * Conquer sector - to the claimer - if it was the last station. $killer.owner is the claimer if there was none before.
* 1 because $stations returns [THIS] (not destroyed yet).
* if some npc race has claimed it and the killer isn't the player, let them own it now. NPC conquer sector.
* ZH 2.0 added the Xenon. Their capship fleets should be able to conquer too.
* only the OCV can also claim an already empty sector, see Mayhem.Task.OCVInvader.Leader
* ** DEBUG (Added in Add-Ons 1.4.21) **
* $t = 'killed last station by ' + $killer.owner
* write to player logbook $t
* Last station is destroyed by some other race other than the station owner, so it gets abandoned.
* ZH 2.0 - Phanon sector protection
* player is unable to cause abandoned Phanon sectors, unless he joined with the OCV

line.text: 'Фэнон должны быть вашими друзьями! Их форпост был заменен!'

line.comment: * Mordan4 - add play time when it was abandoned.
* optional quest to destroy Phanon after joining OCV
* Claim the sector if it's not already done.
* better not do this during a Xenon Crisis because the killer owner is not always the one who should get the sector
* ZH 1.8a - player forces work different from the UNC and always conquer Xenon sectors for themselves
* ZH 1.8a - player must always destroy all Xenon stations. UNC forces only 1 so the rest self destructs but docked Xenon still undock, see Mayhem.Conquer
* ZH 2.0 - when player decides to join OCV he cannot clear Xenon sectors anymore

line.text: 'Ксеноны должны быть вашими друзьями! Их форпост был заменен!'

line.comment: * for safety, should actually not happen
* Remove mission if any.
* If this is an NPC outpost, we must transfer backlog to the nearest safe Outpost, if any.
* A Pirate was the owner of this destroyed station. Must be a Pirate base.
* Possible spawning a Pirate Warlord
* Mordan8 - Use a variable created at station creation time to prevent save-scumming.
* MordanB - Keep a timer for when you attack a pirate base. Until this timer expires, the player
* will not be able to dock at any other Pirate bases. You can't whack one and expect the others to let you dock.
* Refugee ship

брошен.
Zero Hour 1.8b: player being held accountable for kills scored by hired Mercs
Add-Ons 1.4.20: Moved to script.
Force no loot drops from Player outposts, so that when upgrading to Capital shipyard, nothing drops.
Yes, this means if you transfer an outpost to the A.I. and then kill it, it still won't drop anything. Deal with it.
Mordan9 - If requested to drop all loot, and the player is in-sector, stations will drop some of whatever they contain. This is built in.
However, if the player is OOS, the game does not naturally drop loot from stations, so we do it here.
Drop loot
We have to manually drop stuff if the player is not in this sector because it's not built into the game. What percentage to drop is anyones best guess.
From 1/2 to 1/4 of each item drops.
Note, when In-Sector with the player, the game will handle station loot drops. I think it drops everything, but not sure.
Don't drop loot
Normally, this simply removes wares from the station cargo so they do not drop. A couple exceptions were added.
Mordan4 - Renegade station drops all it's loot. Otherwise, remove stuff from the station.
Mordan4 - Pirate bases now drop a portion of their cargo bay. Note, this does not try to drop marines.
